description: As New England sweated through a record heat wave, Montana got rare late-June snow. Firefighters are battling wildfires out West, while forecasters eye another possible tropical storm in the Atlantic.
title: Heat and snowfall, rain and wildfires. It’s a week of extreme weather in the U.S

description: The remarks were some of the most hard-hitting to date since Iran-backed Hezbollah began attacking Israel last October across the border with Lebanon in support of Hamas in Gaza.
title: Hezbollah leader  Hassan Nasrallah warns Israel about the cost of a war in Lebanon

description: Lamar's blowout Juneteenth concert, held at the Forum in Los Angeles and live-streamed on Amazon Music, planted flags for the future of LA rap, while uniting in hate for a certain Toronto titan.
title: Kendrick Lamar takes the West Coast off standby

description: Travis Scott was arrested in Miami on Thursday for allegedly drunken and disorderly conduct after an altercation at the Miami Beach Marina.
title: Rapper Travis Scott is arrested in Miami for trespassing and intoxication

description: In her latest work, Cusk probes questions about the connections between freedom, gender, domesticity, art, and suffering.
title: In 'Parade,' Rachel Cusk once again flouts traditional narrative

description: If current cancer trends continue, authors of a new study project “cancer incidence in the US could remain unacceptably high for decades to come.”
title: As they enter their 60s, Gen Xers projected to see cancer higher rates than Boomers

description: Electronic dance music is one of the largest and most popular sectors of the music industry. But do you know where it came from? Test yourself with Throughline’s quiz.
title: Who built house music? Test your knowledge with the Throughline quiz.

description: Catherine Newman's novel Sandwich centers on a woman vacationing with her young adult children and her elderly parents. Julie Satow’s When Women Ran Fifth Avenue profiles three NYC department stores.
title: 2 books offer just the right summer mix of humor and nostalgia

description: Astronomical summer officially arrives in the Northern Hemisphere — amidst a heat wave — at 4:51 p.m. ET. It's the earliest start to the season since 1796, thanks to quirks in the calendar.
title: Summer officially arrives with the earliest solstice in more than 2 centuries

description: The case had potentially trillions of dollars in tax consequences for the federal budget, and the court's decision could have severely limited congressional options in enacting tax policy.
title: Supreme Court leaves Trump-era offshore tax in place on investors

description: A project in Alabama seeks to drastically grow the number of home-based child care options. It could help the state's workforce, especially during nontraditional hours.
title: She's turning her home into a child care site. It may solve a big problem in Alabama

description: There are concerns that a new election data system that's being pushed by conservative activists and is fueling many mass challenges of registrations could kick legitimate voters off the rolls.
title: A data tool being used to challenge voter registrations is raising many concerns

title: A data tool being used to challenge voter registrations is raising many concerns
